name: miscanthus production | miscanthus, chopped | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3010/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of miscanthus (dry matter) on a plantation with a lifetime of 20 years. The moisture content at storage is 14% (= 15% water on a dry mass basis). Miscanthus is harvested annually from the second year on. Dry matter yield at first harvest is 6'000 kg/ha, from second harvest onwards 17'000 kg/ha.

This activity assumes miscanthus production on a plantation with a lifetime of 20 years and represents the average operation expenditures of the production of 1 kg of miscanthus averaged across the whole lifetime including establishment, operation and clearing of the plantation. The inputs of seed, mineral fertilisers and pesticides are considered. 

The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding inputs of machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, planting, fertilisation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, harvest and chopping of miscanthus and transport from field to farm (2 km) and clearing of the plantation by rotary tiller including growing of oil radish (not harvested) for shading the field and inhibiting regrowth of miscanthus. Further, direct field emissions are included. This activity ends after mulching of the oil radish and with provision of chopped miscanthus at the farm gate.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0129:Growing of other perennial crops

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The amounts of the flows are averages across all years of the plantation lifetime.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The inventories were generated on the basis of data from the 'GruBE' project (Hölscher et al. 2007) and complemented with information from expert estimates, extension service documents and literature. The sources used in the project were KTBL (2006) and personal communications from producers. --- Sources: Hölscher T., Deinmling S., Freiermuth Knuchel R., Gaillard G., Kägi T. & Müller-Sämann K. (2007) Energieoptionen aus landwirtschaftlicher Biomasse am Oberrhein - Auswirkungen für Landwirtschaft und Umwelt - Endbericht zum Projekt. Agentur für Nachhaltige Nutzung von Agrarlandschaften (ANNA). Müllheim, Germany. --- KTBL (2006) Energiepflanzen. Daten für die Planung des Energiepflanzenanbaus. Kuratorium für Technik und Bauwesen in der Landwirtschaft, Darmstadt, 372 p.

exchanges.description: This exchange refers to the variety Miscanthus giganteus, which is mainly grown as a biofuel.

The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'miscanthus, chopped' is calculated to be circa 1.28E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'magnesium oxide', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.56E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
